# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for the function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string (the column name) as an argument and performs the required transformations. It converts all characters to lowercase using the `lowercase` function, removes leading and trailing whitespaces with `strip`, replaces any occurrences of one or more spaces or hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function and returns the cleaned column name.

Note: The `r"[\s-]+"` part of the code is a regular expression that matches one or more whitespace characters (`\s`) or hyphens (`-`).
